required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigating the Safety and Effect of Overnight Orthokeratology and Its Influencing Factors
clinical_study.official_title: Investigating the Safety and Effect of Overnight Orthokeratology and Its Influencing Factors

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the Safety and Effect of Overnight Orthokeratology and Its Influencing Factors in China

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who were successfully prescribed with orthokeratology lenses in Eye Center of the Second Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine were enrolled in the study. Our study used two different methods to collect data. For complications and effect of orthokeratology information, data were collected by a retrospective survey. A questionnaire was used to collect influencing factors of safety and effect of orthokeratology.

study_pop.textblock: myopia patients who were using orthokeratology for myopia control

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who were successfully prescribed with ortho-k lenses in Eye Center of the Second Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have ceased wearing orthokeratology or who were using other methods of myopia control

overall_official.affiliation: 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University, China

facility.name: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University
